articles.title: South Africa enters third virus wave | The Guardian Nigeria News - Nigeria and World News — World — The Guardian Nigeria News – Nigeria and World News - Guardian
articles.description: South Africa has officially entered its third wave of coronavirus infections, health authorities said, with rising caseloads and a sluggish vaccine rollout fuelling fears of fresh strain on the health system.
articles.content: FILE PHOTO: A learner is screened as schools begin to reopen after the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) lockdown in Langa township in Cape Town, South Africa June 8, 2020. REUTERS/Mike Hutchings/File P… [+2218 chars]

articles.title: South Africa faces more lockdown restrictions as cases spike: report - BusinessTech
articles.description: Health experts have warned that South Africa could introduce further lockdown restrictions as the country officially enters into a third Covid-19 wave of infections.
articles.content:

articles.title: Twitter Suspension in Nigeria: US Condemns Move, Calls for Decision Reversal - Gadgets 360
articles.description: The United States condemned the Nigerian government for suspending Twitter and targeting individuals who use the social media site, including Nigerian broadcasters, and called for the African nation to reverse its decision.

articles.title: Africa needs 225m more COVID-19 vaccines to meet coverage target - Guardian
articles.description: To meet the target of vaccinating 10 per cent of its population by September, Africa needs 225 million more COVID-19 jabs, the World Health Organisation (WHO) has disclosed.

articles.title: South African retail giant suffers R719 million operating loss - BusinessTech
articles.description: Retailer The Foschini Group reported an operating loss of R719.2 million for the year ended March 2021, hit hard by the impact of the Covid-19 pandemic and resulting lockdowns in the various territories in which it operates.

articles.title: NASA's New Spacesuits Are Incredible – 2oceansvibe News | South African and international news - 2oceansvibe News
articles.description: NASA is designing new spacesuits for the Artemis missions, which will be taking the first woman and the first person of colour to the moon in 2024.
